treatment.description: Leaves uniformly hispidulous to hirsutulous (hairs spreading to spreading-arching, stiff). Cypselae 1.8–2 mm. 2n = 18.
treatment.habitat: sometimes with sagebrush or mountain mahogany, common in treeless areas
often with yellow, bristlecone, or limber pine
treatment.discussion: Variety pinzliae is found in California, central Nevada, and west-central Utah. It apparently is discontinuously different from var. clokeyi and might be better treated at specific rank. Its relationship to Erigeron pygmaeus should be studied in such a consideration.
